title: Accessibility Problems in Help View
description: When launching the Help view, I need to first click on one of the 'live' areas before it starts working (e.g., the banner with the tool buttons, the nav frame, or the content frame).
OB: The Help view does not respond to keyboard navigation when initially launched; the tab key does not have any effect.
EB: We should ensure that the Help view is immediately navigable via the keyboard upon launch, without the need to click on specific 'live' areas.
SR:
1. On March 26, 2002, using a Windows 2000 machine, launch the Help view in the software.
2. Attempt to navigate through the Help view using the tab key.
3. Observe that the tab key does not perform any expected navigation.
